New Records: The White Sox snapped a historic streak by winning a game started by Chris Flexen after losing 20 consecutive games started by him, an MLB record.
Key Match Events: The White Sox rallied for five hits off Red Sox reliever Zack Kelly in a five-run ninth inning.
Korey Lee threw out Trevor Story as he tried to steal second base in the third inning.
Dominic Fletcher made a strong throw to get Jarren Duran out at home plate in the first inning.
Chris Flexen recorded his 10th quality start of the season, holding Boston to six hits and striking out six.
Pre-Game Insights: Interim manager Grady Sizemore emphasized the importance of playing clean, competitive baseball.
Post-Match Reflections: Grady Sizemore praised the team's clean play and clutch at-bats.
Chris Flexen reflected on his routine and the importance of not giving up.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Korey Lee returned to the lineup after being a late scratch on Friday and sitting out Saturday due to a back tweak.
The win ensured a happy flight home for the White Sox.
